Optimization Tools¶

Auxiliary Functions¶

Python module used to store auxiliary functions that are used in the rest of the code.

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.create_folder(fdir: str) → None¶

Tries to create the directory specified.

If new folder can’t be created, function raises error.

Parameters

fdir (str) – Directory of new folder to be created.

Raises

ValueError – For some reason folder could not be created.

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.folder_exists(fdir: str) → None¶

If folder does not exist, create one.

Parameters

fdir (str) – Directory to check for existence.

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.get_num(string: str) → int¶

Return number from last results .csv version.

Parameters

string (str) – String with the name of the results.csv file.

Returns

Number of last version of results.

Return type

int

Examples

  • Results_V7.csv: 7 (Function captures the number)

  • Results_V12.csv: 12 (Function captures the whole number!)

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.last_result(fdir: str, fname: str) → int¶

Get last version number from all results file on directory.

Parameters

fdir (str) – Directory where results are being stored.

Returns

Last version number from all results at the base directory.

Return type

int

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.path_exists(fdir: str, raise_error: bool = False) → bool¶

Check if path exists.

Parameters

fdir (str) – Directory to check for existence.

Returns

Returns True if path exists and nothing if it doesn’t.

Return type

True, None

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.round_values(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, column_name: str, decimal_points: int) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Round a DataFrame to a variable number of decimal places.

Method uses for…loop in order to be able to round values even when column has non-numeric values.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe object with column to be rounded.

  • column_name (str) – Name of the column with values to be rounded.

  • decimal_points (int, dict, Series) – Number of decimal places to round each column to. If an int is given, round each column to the same number of places. Otherwise dict and Series round to variable numbers of places. Column names should be in the keys if decimals is a dict-like, or in the index if decimals is a Series. Any columns not included in decimals will be left as is. Elements of decimals which are not columns of the input will be ignored.

Returns

df – DataFrame object.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

optimization.opt_tools.aux_funcs.save_results(result, fdir: str, fname: str = 'results') → None¶

Save model results.

Saves the results obtained from the model at the specified directory using the version control convention established.

Parameters

  • fdir (str) – Directory that the results will be saved.

  • result (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – Dataframe with the optimization model’s results.

  • fname (str Defaults='results') – Filename in which results should be saved.

Returns

Return type

None.

Load Data¶

Module with methods for loading inventory reports.

Note

At this moment, this model supports .csv .xlsx file formats.

Warning

.xlsx files should have inventory report as first sheet (otherwise it won’t work).

optimization.opt_tools.load_data.check_extension(fext: str) → None¶

Check if file extension is supported.

Parameters

(str) (fext) –

Raises

ValueError – Raises error if extension is not supported.:

optimization.opt_tools.load_data.get_file_extension(fname: str) → str¶

Return file extension.

Parameters

(str) (fname) –

Returns

Return type

File extension.

optimization.opt_tools.load_data.load_csv(fdir: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Loads csv file.

Parameters

(str) (fdir) –

Returns

pd.DataFrame

Return type

Pandas dataframe of the loaded csv.

optimization.opt_tools.load_data.load_data(fdir: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Load dataframe.

Method calls function that determines the file extension, then it calls the appropriate method to load the file.

Note

Supported file formats should be added at module constants list named supported_file_extensions

Methods

  • get_file_extension(fdir)

  • load_csv(fdir)

  • load_excel(fdir)

Parameters

fdir (str) – Filepath of the dataframe.

Returns

x_df – Dataframe loaded.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

optimization.opt_tools.load_data.load_excel(fdir: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Loads excel file into pandas DataFrame.

This method is an extension of load_data. After load_data determines the file extension, and if the extension is of type .xlsx, load_data calls this method to load the excel file.

Parameters

(str) (fdir) –

Returns

pd.DataFrame

Return type

Dataframe loaded.

Module Contents¶

Auxiliary functions created to assist on generating the optimization results.

Submodules¶

aux_funcs

Python module used to store auxiliary functions that are used in the rest of the code.

load_data

Module with methods for loading inventory reports.
